Maybe @civilmanxx is confused with the output of nvidia-smi. Be aware that the device ordering provided by CUDA might be different from the device ordering shown by nvidia-smi.
Using CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=0 might actually give you the latest device when checking utilization with nvidia-smi.
To get consistent numbering, use CUDA_​DEVICE_​ORDER=PCI_BUS_ID, this is documented here

body:
Maybe @civilmanxx is confused with the output of `nvidia-smi`. Be aware that the device ordering provided by CUDA might be different from the device ordering shown by `nvidia-smi`.
Using `CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=0` might actually give you the **latest** device when checking utilization with `nvidia-smi`.
To get consistent numbering, use `CUDA_​DEVICE_​ORDER=PCI_BUS_ID`, this is documented [here](https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-c-programming-guide/#env-vars)
